name: Pharmacy/Treatment Component Order
description: The RXC segment contains component details for pharmacy orders or treatment applications. This segment is used to specify individual components of complex medication orders, including compound medications, IV solutions with multiple additives, and other multi-component therapeutic preparations. It provides detailed information about each component including quantities, concentrations, and administration details.

cardinality.note: RXC segments repeat for each component in a compound medication or complex therapy order

RXC.1.name: RX Component Type
RXC.1.description: This field identifies the type of component being specified in this RXC segment. It distinguishes between base solutions, additives, and primary active ingredients.
RXC.1.generationHint: B for primary medication/solution, A for additives or adjunct components

RXC.2.name: Component Code
RXC.2.description: This field contains the code for the specific medication or solution component. Uses standard pharmaceutical coding systems to identify the component substance.
RXC.2.generationHint: Use NDC or RxNorm codes for pharmaceutical components

RXC.3.name: Component Amount
RXC.3.description: This field specifies the amount of the component to be included in the compound medication or solution. This is the numeric quantity that corresponds to RXC.4 (Component Units).
RXC.3.generationHint: Numeric amount: 500, 1000, 2.5, 10, 250 for IV solutions and additives

RXC.4.name: Component Units
RXC.4.description: This field contains the units for the component amount specified in RXC.3. Essential for precise compounding and dosing calculations.
RXC.4.generationHint: Match unit type to component: mL for liquids, mg/g for solids, units for biologics

RXC.5.name: Component Strength
RXC.5.description: This field contains the strength or concentration of the component when different from the standard preparation strength.

RXC.6.name: Component Strength Units
RXC.6.description: This field contains the units for the component strength specified in RXC.5. Used for concentration and strength specifications.
RXC.6.generationHint: Common IV concentrations: % for dextrose/saline, mg/mL for most drugs

RXC.7.name: Supplementary Code
RXC.7.description: This field contains supplementary codes for the component, such as lot numbers, batch identifiers, or additional classification codes.
RXC.7.generationHint: Lot numbers: LOT123456789, batch codes, or secondary identifiers

RXC.8.name: Component Drug Strength Volume
RXC.8.description: This field contains the volume associated with the drug strength when the strength is expressed as a concentration (e.g., mg per mL).
RXC.8.generationHint: Volume denominators: 1 (for per mL), 5 (for per 5mL), 100 (for per 100mL)

RXC.9.name: Component Drug Strength Volume Units
RXC.9.description: This field contains the units for the volume specified in RXC.8, typically mL for liquid preparations.
RXC.9.generationHint: Almost always mL for pharmaceutical preparations

notes: RXC segments are essential for complex medication compounding and IV therapy
Each component requires precise quantity and unit specifications for safety
Base components (RXC.1=B) should precede additive components (RXC.1=A)
Strength and concentration fields ensure accurate pharmaceutical preparation
Multiple RXC segments work together to define complete compound medications
Critical for pharmacy automation and compounding verification systems

dataConsistency.componentTypeOrder: Base components (B) should be specified before additives (A)
dataConsistency.unitMatching: RXC.3 and RXC.4 must be compatible quantity and unit pairs
dataConsistency.strengthSpecification: RXC.5 and RXC.6 should be used together when specifying concentrations
dataConsistency.volumeUnits: RXC.8 and RXC.9 are paired for concentration denominators

businessRules.safetyValidation: Component combinations should be validated for compatibility
businessRules.concentrationLimits: Strength values must be within safe therapeutic ranges
businessRules.standardPreparations: Use standard pharmaceutical concentrations when possible
businessRules.componentCoding: All components must use valid pharmaceutical coding systems
